video.title: The Ultimate Guide to the Presidents
video.synopsis: From Washington to Obama, the role of the commander in chief has evolved over generations, and each man has left his personal mark on the Oval Office.

seasons.title: The Ultimate Guide to the Presidents

episodes.synopsis: After the war for independence, the founding fathers create a democracy that divides power among judicial, legislative and executive branches.
episodes.title: Assume the Position 1789-1825

episodes.synopsis: Under the next six presidents, the fledgling democracy feeds gains in U.S. territory and influence while average citizens see increased opportunities.
episodes.title: Power to the People 1824-1849

episodes.synopsis: As confrontations over slavery escalate in the nation's newest territories, efforts to reach a compromise culminate in a high-stakes Civil War.
episodes.title: A House Divided 1849-1865

episodes.synopsis: Lincoln's death leaves the country without a strong leader, but a series of weak presidents who surrender their power only makes the problem worse.
episodes.title: Executive Retreat 1865-1901

episodes.synopsis: Facing a fast-deepening divide between rich and poor, a new president institutes radical reforms to improve the lives of average citizens.
episodes.title: Call of Duty 1899-1921

episodes.synopsis: During the economic boom of the 1920s, presidents allow Congress to act unrestricted until the Depression and another war demand a stronger leader.
episodes.title: Changing of the Guard 1920-1945

episodes.synopsis: America emerges as a superpower after World War II, but the Cold War and other international and domestic concerns demand a new kind of leader.
episodes.title: Hail to the Chief 1945-1964

episodes.synopsis: A more powerful presidency faces challenges from a contentious Congress, a skeptical media and an indifferent public, not to mention global terror.
episodes.title: Mantle of Power 1965-2013
